abstract.text: An object that you use to configure new Metal texture objects.

inlineContent.text: To create a new texture, first create a
object and set its property values. Then, call either the
When you create a texture, Metal copies property values from the descriptor into the new texture. You can reuse a
object, modifying its property values as needed, to create more
objects, without affecting any textures you already created.

abstract.text: An object that creates textures from existing data in common image formats.
Render advanced 3D graphics and compute data in parallel with graphics processors.
A resource that stores data in a format defined by your app.
Creates a texture that shares its storage with the buffer.
The main Metal interface to a GPU that apps use to draw graphics and run computations in parallel.
Creates a new texture instance.
Creates a texture instance that uses I/O surface to store its underlying data.
The data formats that describe the organization and characteristics of individual pixels in a texture.
A texture handle that can be shared across process address space boundaries.
A resource that holds formatted image data.
An object that you use to configure new Metal texture objects.
A Boolean value indicating whether the GPU is allowed to adjust the texture’s contents to improve GPU performance.
The number of array elements for this texture.
The CPU cache mode used for the CPU mapping of the texture.
The depth of the texture image for the base level mipmap, in pixels.
The texture’s hazard tracking mode.
The height of the texture image for the base level mipmap, in pixels.
The number of mipmap levels for this texture.
The size and bit layout of all pixels in the texture.
The behavior of a new memory allocation.
The number of samples in each fragment.
The location and access permissions of the texture.
The pattern you want the GPU to apply to pixels when you read or sample pixels from the texture.
Creates a texture descriptor object for a 2D texture.
Creates a texture descriptor object for a texture buffer.
Creates a texture descriptor object for a cube texture.
The dimension and arrangement of texture image data.
Options that determine how you can use the texture.
The width of the texture image for the base level mipmap, in pixels.
A set of options to choose from when creating a texture swizzle pattern.
A pattern that modifies the data read or sampled from a texture by rearranging or duplicating the elements of a vector.
Creates a new swizzle pattern.
The dimension of each image, including whether multiple images are arranged into an array or a cube.
An enumeration for the various options that determine how you can use a texture.
Select an appropriate storage mode for your textures and buffers on Apple GPUs.

doc://com.apple.metal/documentation/Meta.title: Choosing a Resource Storage Mode for Apple GPUs

abstract.text: Optimize a texture’s data to improve GPU or CPU access.
Set a storage mode that defines the memory location and access permissions of a resource.
Manually synchronize memory for a Metal resource in apps.

doc://com.apple.metal/documentation/Meta.title: Synchronizing a Managed Resource in macOS

abstract.text: Know the size limits of color render targets in Apple GPUs based on the target’s pixel format.
The root class of most Objective-C class hierarchies, from which subclasses inherit a basic interface to the runtime system and the ability to behave as Objective-C objects.
A protocol that objects adopt to provide functional copies of themselves.
The group of methods that are fundamental to all Objective-C objects.
A type that can be hashed into a `Hasher` to produce an integer hash value.
A type that can be compared for value equality.
A type with a customized textual representation.
A type with a customized textual representation suitable for debugging purposes.
A type whose instances can be encoded, and appropriately passed, as elements of a C `va_list`.
